jurisdiction.title: Roman Catholic Diocese of Joliet Illinois

56E551022A354305A75051594E9EF8C1.description:
Identify historically significant people
in the Church who affected social life
or institutions, e.g. Dorothy Day, Oscar
Romero.

5FB81DC81E68496AA1D623ACDB989094.description:
Identify historically significant people
who affected social life or institutions.

1D1CBD8EA2944F4BB6150D0169741223.description:
Describe ways school administrators,
teachers, students, and parents can
cooperate to address school issues.

62E3EA10D19C4F53A7C93F867B5F8F64.description:
Understand how social systems form and develop over time. Understand how religious/Church social systems form and develop over time. Value the significance and impact of the Catholic Church throughout history. CSDS5 (K-6 CS)
Value history as a medium to assist in recognizing and rejecting contemporary cultural values that threaten human dignity and are contrary
to the Gospel message. CSDS5 (7-12 CS)
Value unique qualities and characteristics of different cultures in order to pursue peace and understanding, knowledge and truth. CSDS6
(7& 8)

8C09490FF6DA410F86CAA3CD9D973E08.description:
Describe how our parish serves the
needs of its members and the larger
community.

FC8F3B5A16E247A6BA52F70D5B461B6B.description:
Give an example of how different
social institutions or groups (e.g.,
religious, nonprofit and community
groups) address the same social
problems.

028BDBD7BD64452CB9EDA368137FB32C.description:
Describe how national institutions
affect individuals in the local
community.

F87A0658442246BDA97D95E6F581DD32.description:
Explain how interactions of individuals
and groups impact the local
community.

F19157A052CA492AB49FE6D3FA23385A.description:
Analyze how social institutions or
groups meet the needs of people.

E3BAB6BF4FB54BDF8FACF9F7EAAACAF4.description:
Understand the roles and interactions of individuals and groups in society. Understand the roles and interactions of individuals and groups in society and their role in the Church. Value the diversity among students in the classroom and school community as children of God. CSDS3
Analyze stories of important Catholic figures and saints who through their examples re-awaken that period’s moral sense. CSGS3 (7&8)
Discuss how religious and moral knowledge is a requisite for understanding the dram of human grandeur throughout history. CSGS4 (7&8
Value one’s own role and dignity in God’s plan and creation. CSGS5 (7&8)

FABDB7D007CC48EEAEAD5939A2ED928D.description:
Describe the influence of the Catholic
Church on art, music and literature.

300DA894633647FF8C3927088AE95474.description:
Compare cultural
differences/similarities with students
from a different part of the United
States.

F44B36D5A1CC481A8C23B22DAF08E731.description:
Compare the celebrations of holidays
by cultures throughout the world.

87751F045BEC44FF9B0D16FEC3E2E6EA.description:
Describe how social celebrations
(parades, fairs) reinforce cultural
values.

EC46852597BB49458E0AD3DC332E57BF.description:
Describe how an artistic tradition has
been changed by technology (e.g.,
photography, music).

E6D0AEE8855F45D392C50F5203E1B146.description:
Describe how culture is shared through
music, art, and literature throughout the
world over time.

31E7DECE363B43D99E936F446FD9029E.description:
Compare characteristics of culture as reflected in language, literature, the arts, traditions, and institutions. Compare characteristics of religious culture as reflected in language, literature, the arts, traditions, and institutions.  Select and describe beautiful artifacts from different times and cultures. CSDS1
Value the cultural inheritance the Church provides us yesterday and today. CSGS3
Value the unique qualities and characteristics of different cultures in order to pursue peace and understanding, knowledge and truth. CSDS6
(7&8)

4253193CF9644AF59E132FBB823CC3A0.description: Understand social systems, with an emphasis on the United States. Understand religious aspects of social systems with an emphasis on the United States
